case.name: Bowen Investments Pty Ltd v Tabcorp Holdings Ltd (No 2) [2007] FCA 878 (12 June 2007)

citphrases.citphrase: whether the respondent obtained the requisite consent of the applicant to alter the premises pursuant to clause 2.13 of the lease
reinstatement clause in heads of agreement not appearing in final executed lease
whether landlord entitled to rectification of clause
whether parties laboured under a common mistake that the lease contained a general "make good" clause in the terms appearing in heads of agreement trade practices
action for damages to be commenced within six years after cause of action accrued
any loss or damage crystallised at the time alteration to premises occurred in july and august 1997
causes of action statute barred torts
whether respondent has committed a voluntary waste
action for damages in tort to be commenced within six years after cause of action accrued
cause of action statute barred damages
onus on landlord to prove actual damage suffered
no diminution to value of building
compensatory damages awarded for restoration of foyer to its original proportions
nominal damages awarded for respondent's failure to abide by its obligations under clause 2.13 of the lease
whether costs should follow the event
where applicants did not pursue application for interlocutory relief in favour of early trial
where affidavits contained unnecessary detail and inaccuracies and were given low weight
costs of senior and junior counsel contested
whether judgment for less than $50,000 on money claim
whether as a matter of discretion the rule ought to apply
applicability of o.62 sub-r.36a(2). trade practices act 1974 s.52 federal court rules o.62 sub-r.36a(1) and (2)
